intro: Astronia negrosensis, commonly known as the Negros astronia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Astronia negrosensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance.
